text.section:
Except as otherwise prohibited by law, the Treasurer may invest or reinvest, in a deposit with a financial institution in the State, unexpended or surplus money over which the Treasurer has custody if:
the deposit is interest bearing; and
as provided for a depositary for State money:
the financial institution provides collateral that has a market value that equals or exceeds the amount by which a deposit exceeds the deposit insurance; and
a custodian holds the collateral.
The Treasurer may sell, redeem, or exchange an investment or reinvestment made under this section.
